body.p:
Mount Vernon Ky
July 13th 1861
B Magoffin Gov

Dear Sir at the august election 1860 we were elected Col and Lieut Col of the Enroled malitia of Rockcastle county, shortly thereafter we send to the adjutant General our resignation as such, and have never taken upon ourselves the duties of said officers, but have heard nothing as to whether it was received. the offices does not suit us as we are attos at law and are generally absent from home when the law requires us to muster.

I think it would be well to have an election ordered for august next to fill said vacancys (or we have tender you our resignation again) we have plenty competent persons to fill the offices and we would like to see the county organized
as the war sport seems to be rampant in our land, and in view of the mighty strugle that is going on it would be well for all to understand the manuel of arms as we know not how soon Ky may engaged in this unatural conflict.

Your obdnt servants
J G Hazlewood
F. B. McClary

To B Magoffin
Governor of Ky
Rockcastle Co
Col. & Lt. Col
Resignation
July 19. 1861
